Description: Fragment of base and wall of Chian pottery cup or mug. Flat floor and low, ring foot. White slip. Interior glazed; exterior: dilute line at base of wall, outside of foot glazed.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Published in Fairbanks 1928, p. 98, pl. XXXII, no. 302.4. Fairbanks, A.1928, Catalogue of Greek and Etruscan Vases, Boston.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 210, no. 5)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 98, pl. XXXII, no. 302.4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2214)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4651 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
